channel.title: Michal Ferber
channel.description: This website is a virtual proof that I'm awesome

item.title: The new Admin On-Demand feature in the Mosyle MDM
item.description: A How To Guide - A new feature in the Mosyle MDM is the ability to allow users to have admin permission only when they need it. In the past, you had to use a static password that the user knew or rotate the password and then give the password when the user asks for...

item.title: September 23 – Part 1
item.description: A personal story - My personal life has taken a lot of twists and turns. And as much as I have tried to control everything and be perfect in everything, I have found out the hard way that just isn’t how life works. I have also found that it’s the exact opposite of following...

item.title: Stars We Lost in 2019
item.description: Year in review - I read an article today on Fox News entitled “Stars We Lost in 2019”. It listed 157 celebrities that died in 2019. Some were household names like Robert Forster who played Bud Baxter on Last Man Standing. Another was legendary wrestling announcer “Mean” Gene Okerlund who died at the age...

item.title: Vesta Alert Notification System
item.description: South Carolina ARC GIS conference - I had the opportunity to present and share my thoughts on emergency communication and how GIS can play a role at the South Carolina ARC GIS conference.

item.title: An open letter to Christians everywhere (including me)
item.description: From the heart - I just watched America’s Got Talent and saw what I hope is a career rebirth of another sinner saved by grace: Nikki Leonti Edgar (Wikipedia). My heart was broken listening to her story and realizing that I listened to her singing Christian music as a kid than hearing that she...

item.title: It’s all about Effective, Efficient Communication
item.description: That’s Just the Bottom Line - Interview I had about communicating with communication technology solutions.

item.title: Integrating Emergency Notification into Your Everyday Communications Strategy
item.description: Speaking at Disaster Recovery Journal | Spring World 2010 - The economic downturn has forced organizations to think outside the box to maintain operations and improve efficiencies. Many have found innovative ways to capitalize on technological investments, including emergency notification, through integration with other applications. McLeod Health leveraged its vendor-supplied Application Programming Interface (API) and associated development toolkit. Learn how...
